children.subject:
<another anon> I think there's no good way to answer this question, since it really varies person to person. I found 188 fairly difficult because I just didn't really understand the concepts, and the exams really test if you understand all of the course material and can solve problems. That being said, I think the exams weren't harder than any other course I've taken, and what I just said goes for any class. Then again I think that all of the CS classes I've taken have had hard exams... [61ABC, 70 170 161 188] actually I think 161 exams weren't that bad. Anyways yeah I don't think you should really worry about this question. Just study, understand the material, and the exams will be as they are.

tldr: they're not really harder than other classes in my opinion. Just people don't study as much during the semester and blow the class off, so everyone thinks the exams are hard.
[I'm the OP] Thanks, that was sort of what I figured but just wanted to make sure. This was just the answer I was looking for.
It's hard.. idk how to scale it compared to other classes but they're hard

history.content: Hard is in much difficult compared to the HWs/lecture coverage of the class.

As per title. I've heard this class has a relatively light workload but the exams are hard... so I was wondering how hard? 

I know I posted a similar question a while back but I realize I wasn’t clear about the "compared to other classes" part. Thought that might give me a better sense of the difficulty.

I’m thinking about taking this class next semester, so any info is much appreciated!
history.subject: How hard are CS 188 exams compared to other classes?
